### Prerequisites

- [X] Write a descriptive title.
- [X] Make sure you are able to repro it on the [latest released version](https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell/releases)
- [X] Search the existing issues.
- [X] Refer to the [FAQ](https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell/blob/master/docs/FAQ.md).
- [X] Refer to [Differences between Windows PowerShell 5.1 and PowerShell](https://docs.microsoft.com/powershell/scripting/whats-new/differences-from-windows-powershell).

### Steps to reproduce

```pwsh
& {
Trap [Microsoft.PowerShell.Commands.ServiceCommandException]{"service not found"}
Trap{"Error Trapped!"}
Get-Service abc -ErrorAction Stop
$error[0].Exception.GetType().FullName
}
```
Execution results:
```
Error Trapped!
Get-Service:
Line |
   4 |  Get-Service ALF -ErrorAction Stop
     |  ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
     | Cannot find any service with service name 'ALF'.
Microsoft.PowerShell.Commands.ServiceCommandException
```

This is because the `ServiceCommandException` was wrapped in `System.Management.Automation.ActionPreferenceStopException` (because of `-ErrorAction Stop`). This unwrapping is done for `try {} catch {}`, but not for `trap`. Here is the behavior with `try/catch`

```
try {
    Get-Service abc -ErrorAction Stop
} catch [System.Management.Automation.ActionPreferenceStopException] {
    "exception caught"
}
```
with the reuslt:
```
PS:47> try {
>>     Get-Service abc -ErrorAction Stop
>> } catch [System.Management.Automation.ActionPreferenceStopException] {
>>     "exception caught"
>> }
exception caught
```

### Expected behavior

```console
The `Trap [Microsoft.PowerShell.Commands.ServiceCommandException]{"service not found"}` statement should be hit as the exception type is `Microsoft.PowerShell.Commands.ServiceCommandException`
```


### Actual behavior

```console
That trap statement doesn't get hit.
```
